body:
This seems like a bug in GLFW. Thank you for reporting this!

What keyboard layout do you have set? Do you get the error when calling `glfwGetKeyName`?

> What keyboard layout do you have set? Do you get the error when calling `glfwGetKeyName`?

My keyboard is the usual qwerty layout.
This error message I got in the GLFWErrorCallback function.
@v-dao Which language do you have the keyboard set to? What version of Windows are you running?

@elmindreda Windows 10 professional 21H2.
I use "Chinese (Simplified, China) - Microsoft Pinyin" for my keyboard.
> 中文(简体，中国)

This error does not occur when I switch the keyboard to "English (United States)".
This should be fixed now with 6dd526fb1a9c16c3170a0ebd2b5c73e4a2719245. Thank you for the bug report!
I got a similar error (ERROR GLFW error #65540: Invalid scancode). I solved it by changing the keyboard language to ENG US.

issue.title: Defunct keys (Enter, ESC) leading to no chat interaction

labels.name: P3: Standard
labels.description: Priority: Default priority for repository items.

labels.name: Changes: UI
labels.description: Changes: Might require knowledge of UI design or code.

repository.name: space-station-14
repository.description: A multiplayer game about paranoia and chaos on a space station. Remake of the cult-classic Space Station 13.

issue.body:
## Description
Some key interactions do not work in the Steam Version on my machine. I can only write characters in the chat, but not erase them with backspace or move via arrow keys. Even sending does not work. ESC works only via Mouse Click. 



**Additional context**
Linux Version of Steam
Build ID 5864008

Operating System: Manjaro Linux
KDE Plasma Version: 5.21.1
KDE Frameworks Version: 5.79.0
Qt Version: 5.15.2
Kernel Version: 5.10.18-1-MANJARO
OS Type: 64-bit
Graphics Platform: X11
Processors: 16 × AMD Ryzen 7 2700 Eight-Core Processor
Memory: 15.6 GiB of RAM
Graphics Processor: Radeon RX 590 Series
